Package IO

Class FileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • IO.FileReader

  • public class FileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides general access to different kinds of files, e.g. xml-files, json-files key-value files etc. For each file type there must be a particular reader, which can read the file and turn it into an object of a specific kind. For example, a key-value file is turned into a HashMap<String,String>. For each file type there must be a particular class with the following public methods:
    - static String getFilenameExtension() which yields a regular expression for the filename extension it can read.
    - static String getFileType() which yields string that characterises the file type (maybe the same as the filename extension).
    - Object readStream(HashMap<String,String>, String name, InputStream stream, long length, StringBuilder errors).
    These classes can either be part of the project, or they can be stored in a separate directory from where they are loaded at run time. Newer versions of such .class files can be loaded at any time by calling readFileReaderClasses. All File-Reader classes which are part of the project must have a code snippet
    static {FileReader.addReader([myName].class);}
    which registers itself at the FileReader class. In addition the main-method must call [myName].getFilenameExtension(); which causes the class to be loaded and registered.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public static void clear​()

      • reset

        public static void reset​()

      • readFileReaderClasses

        public static boolean readFileReaderClasses​(java.io.File directory,
                                            java.lang.String ignore,
                                            java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method reads all .class files from the given directory and registers them as File-Reader classes. The directory should contain only FileReader classes as .class files. The method can be called at any to read newer versions of the FileReader classes.
        Parameters:
        directory - with the File-Reader classes
        ignore - all files whose names matches this regular expression are ignored.
        errors - for inserting error messages.
        Returns:
        true if there was no error.

      • addReader

        public static void addReader​(java.lang.Class clazz)
        This method should be called from the system-internal File-Reader classes, e.g. static {FileReader.addReader(KeyValueFileReader.class);} It registers the class as FileReader. If the class does not conform to the conventions then a stack trace is printed and the system exits.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the file reader class.

      • addReader

        public static boolean addReader​(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method adds an externally read FileReader class. It checks whether all required methods are there and then registers the class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - a class file of a FileReader class.
        errors - for inserting error messages.
        Returns:
        true if there were no errors.

      • findReader

        public static FileReader findReader​(java.lang.String extension)
        The method searches for a FileReader which can read files with the given filename extension.
        Parameters:
        extension - a filename extension, e.g. 'json'
        Returns:
        the FileReader for these file classes, or null if none was found.

      • readFile

        public static DataBlock readFile​(java.net.URL url,
                                 java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method reads at first the .meta file (if there is one) and then the file itself from the URL. It uses the filename extension to determine the appropriate Reader.
        Parameters:
        url - for the file
        errors - for inserting error messages.
        Returns:
        the contents of the file parsed into an object that depends on the file type.

      • readFile

        public static DataBlock readFile​(java.io.File file,
                                 java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method reads at first the .meta file (if there is one) and then the file itself. It uses the filename extension to determine the appropriate Reader.
        Parameters:
        file - the file
        errors - for inserting error messages.
        Returns:
        the contents of the file parsed into an object that depends on the file type.

        Returns:
        a short description of the reader.
